Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for container image storage, access control, and integration with CI/CD pipelines. Identify the applications and services that will use the Azure Container Registry.

Design the architecture for the Azure Container Registry, including the tier (Basic, Standard, Premium), geographic replication needs, and integration with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) or other container platforms.
Provision the Azure Container Registry in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Select the appropriate SKU and configure the registry settings.
Configure geo-replication for the Azure Container Registry to ensure high availability and disaster recovery across multiple regions.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) for the registry to manage permissions for users and applications. Define roles such as Reader, Contributor, and Owner.
Enable content trust to ensure that only signed images are pulled from the registry. Regularly verify the integrity of signed images.
Set up integration with CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, push, and deployment of container images. Use tools like Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
Enable image scanning to detect vulnerabilities in container images stored in the registry.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the registry using Azure Monitor. Set up alerts for storage usage, image pull failures, and other critical metrics.
Perform testing to ensure the registry is functioning as expected. Test image push, pull, and integration with container platforms.
Document the registry setup, configurations, and usage guidelines. Include instructions for developers and operations teams.
Set up backup and recovery procedures for the registry to ensure data integrity and availability in case of failures.
Ensure the registry setup meets compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify security and operational standards.
Configure webhooks to trigger notifications for registry events such as image pushes or deletes. Monitor webhook activity to ensure proper functioning.
Regularly rotate access keys for the Azure Container Registry to enhance security. Update any dependent services or scripts with the new keys.
Review and clean up unused or outdated container images to optimize storage usage. Implement retention policies to automate this process.
Review access logs to monitor and detect unauthorized access or unusual activity. Use Azure Monitor or Azure Security Center for detailed insights.
Periodically review and update the Azure Container Registry configuration to align with best practices and organizational requirements.
Conduct regular tests of the disaster recovery plan to ensure that the Azure Container Registry can be restored in case of a failure.

Tasks.Task: Review and Update Network Security Rules
Tasks.Task Description: Ensure that network security rules for the Azure Container Registry are up-to-date and aligned with organizational policies.
Regularly monitor the usage of Azure Container Registry quotas and limits to ensure that the service operates within its allocated resources.
Provide regular training to the operations team on Azure Container Registry security best practices and updates.
